intro: Gynandropsis viscida, commonly known as the sticky gynandropsis, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves that produce a sticky substance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
